snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel suggested that he had listened to President Obama’s plea to sign on to a framework being drafted by Secretary of State John Kerry.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu makes an uncharacteristically enthusiastic pitch for a peace accord with Palestinians, day after meeting with Pres Obama, in a speech to the American Israel Public Affairs Committee.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel suggested that he had listened to President Obama’s plea to sign on to a framework being drafted by Secretary of State John Kerry.

headline.main: Netanyahu Promotes Efforts Toward a Peace Deal
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Promotes Efforts Toward a Peace Deal
